CONJUGATES: unsociably | unsociability | more unsociable | most unsociable
ETYMOLOGY: From un- (not) + sociable. Sociable derives from Latin sociabilis, from socius (companion).

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Not desiring or enjoying the company of others; reserved or withdrawn.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 不合群的；不愿交际的；孤僻的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: My neighbor is quite unsociable and rarely speaks to anyone in the building.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我的邻居相当孤僻，很少和楼里的任何人说话。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: (Especially of hours or conditions) Not conducive to social interaction or general convenience.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （尤指时间或条件）不适于社交的；不方便的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Working from 11 PM to 7 AM means that I have very unsociable hours.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 晚上11点到早上7点的工作意味着我的工作时间非常不方便社交。
